title: Leighton Meester cuts a casual figure in yellow sweater and jeans at the airport with her daughter
text:
She's best known for her role as queen bee of the Upper East Side, Blair Waldorf.

But Leighton Meester was caught playing the role of mom as she navigated the Toronto International Airport pushing her four-year-old daughter Arlo in a stroller on Monday.

The 33-year-old actress wore an oversize mustard-yellow cardigan with medium-wash ankle length jeans.

There's mommy! Leighton Meester was caught playing the role of mom as she navigated the Toronto International Airport pushing her four-year-old daughter Arlo in a stroller on Monday

Her feet were sheltered in brown suede boots and slung a pink patterned backpack over her shoulder.

Leighton kept her face free of makeup and pushed a massive pink rolling suitcase in one hand with her daughter's stroller handle in another.

Little Arlo wore a white long-sleeved top and strawberry-printed bottoms as she played with a moose toy in her stroller.

Comfy: The 33-year-old actress wore an oversize mustard-yellow cardigan with medium-wash ankle length jeans

Her sighting comes a couple of weeks after she told PorterEdit that she will never reprise her role as Blair Waldorf as Gossip Girl was an 'unhealthy environment' for her.

'I was young when I started Gossip Girl. A lot more people were suddenly around and I was being looked at,' she began.

'If you don’t have the right perspective, you could definitely be confused by people being that nice to you or judging you for behavior that’s typical of a 20, 21 year old … making mistakes but having to make them very publicly.'

On-the-go: Her feet were sheltered in brown suede boots and slung a pink patterned backpack over her shoulder

'I’m not haunted by that time, but it’s been interesting and helpful for me to look at it and examine it as an adult and go, "I don’t know if it was the healthiest environment."'

Although she struggled growing up in the spotlight Leighton admitted that her Gossip Girl days were still a 'special time' filled with challenges from all aspects of life.

She said that she wouldn't change it for the world, but relates it to a high school experience she wouldn't want to return to.

Throwback: Although she struggled growing up in the spotlight Leighton admitted that her Gossip Girl days were still a 'special time' filled with challenges from all aspects of life

The star said: 'It's sort of a time capsule. A lot of the questions that come from it are: "Do you miss it?" "Did you love what you wore?" And I understand that, but - and I say this with nothing but love - it is like saying, "High school was an amazing time for you, do you wish you could go back?"'

Leighton has been married to fellow actor Adam Brody since 2014.
